## 1. Summary
3rdEyeVisuals shared details about an arcade-style gaming implementation in a virtual world environment. The technical approach uses Three.js CanvasTexture with 2D Canvas API rendering directly applied to 3D meshes, rather than using iframes or UI nodes. This method enables raycasting and click detection in world-space, which wasn't possible with UI nodes. The developer had to expose additional low-level APIs with security checks to ensure the implementation remains secure. The system works like a Game Boy screen texture-mapped onto 3D objects, with real-time JavaScript canvas drawing. 

A key optimization is proximity-based rendering, where arcade machines only render when users are nearby. This allows for potentially thousands of arcade machines in a world with only one actual render happening per client at any time, maintaining 60 FPS performance. The developer mentioned this is part of a larger project that will include token-gated features, with some test games available for all users to try.
